title: Joseph Hermon Cawthra
data: Cawthra sculpted a study of a mother and child called Affection which is located in Bishops Park . Made of Portland stone , it was added to the park in 1963
These Cawthra sculptures date from about 1935

For Bentalls Store in Kingston , Surrey and for a major renovation which took place in the 1930s . Cawthra carved several embellishments and also a Coat of Arms . Since then the store has seen further major structural changes and all that now remains of Cawthra 's work is the Coat of Arms
Cawthra sculpted the figure on the top of the dome of Braintree Town Hall in Essex
Cawthra sculpted the figure of Britannia which looks down on Piccadilly Circus in London . The building was originally occupied by the New County Fire Offices

Cawthra worked on figures for the Manchester Town Hall Extension . In a niche at opposite ends of the curved southern side of the building are statues of a standing male figure , one a philosopher and the other a counsellor . Mancunians called them Mr Therm given the presence of gas showrooms in the new building . [ 10 ] This work was carried out in 1938 . Cawthra also sculpted two larger than life relief female figures on the gable at the Lloyd Street and Cooper Street end of the building . Both wear shawls and one holds a ship in her hand whilst the other holds a distaff . They represented commerce and cotton
Cawthra 's composition Meditation was exhibited at the Royal Academy in 1957 . This had stood in Gwendwr Garden , London but was subsequently stolen
Mother and Child , The Church of St Michael and All Angels
For the Church of St Michael and All Angels in North Hull , Cawthra sculpted a work called Mother and child
For the Odeon Cinema in Guildford , Cawthra carved four bas-reliefs . These are now in a private apartment building in Guildford
Cawthra executed these sculptures in about 1935
In 1936 Cawthra completed a relief featuring Robert Burns for the Burns Mausoleum

In 1938 Cawthra carved a relief for the original Sadler 's Wells Theatre . This relief was semi-circular in shape and was positioned over the theatre entrance . The theatre has been effectively re-built but the relief is preserved and kept in a small garden area which can be accessed by using the Stage Door entrance . A photograph of this relief is shown here

To mark the Coronation in 1937 , Selfridges Store in London mounted what it called a sculpted pageant of English History and symbolic Empire groups . Various large bas-reliefs were erected in front of the store . The sculptors given commissions were chosen by William Reid Dick . Cawthra was chosen to sculpt the relief which represented India . The Henry Moore Institute Archive Leeds Cawthra papers reference 1995.9 include cuttings from The London Illustrated News covering these bas-reliefs . These works are of course no longer in situ

intro: Joseph Hermon Cawthra (1886-1971), born in Baildon in Yorkshire, was an English sculptor.
